other_tests.findings: New stranding surrounding the pancreas compatible with acute pancreatitis. A 0.9 x 1.2 cm cystic lesion in the pancreatic tail has grown since the prior study and may be a pseudocyst. Cholelithiasis with decompressed gallbladder. No CT evidence of perforation. No bowel obstruction.
other_tests.changes_over_time: The cystic lesion in the pancreatic tail measured 9 x 12 mm, increased from 9 x 8 mm in the earliest study available.
